intro: Morisonia antonensis, commonly known as the Antón island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the island of Antón in the Galápagos archipelago. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of violet and blue. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and is adapted to the island's unique climate and soil conditions. It is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many climbing plants. Morisonia antonensis is considered rare and is of significant interest to botanists due to its endemic status and ecological role in its native habitat.
